[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Meeting Scheduler System (MSS) defines requirements for efficient meeting scheduling, conflict resolution, and participant prioritization while ensuring seamless API integration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MSS integrates with Google Calendar, Outlook, and Zoom APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MSS provides a responsive web UI for meeting management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MSS runs on cloud-hosted infrastructure, accessible via web browsers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MSS leverages GraphQL and REST APIs, PostgreSQL for storage, and Redis for caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MSS supports real-time updates via WebSockets, email, and SMS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MSS optimizes memory for concurrent scheduling operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MSS automates scheduling, updates availability, and syncs calendars.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MSS supports scheduling, rescheduling, virtual meetings, agenda management, and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MSS supports scheduling, conflict resolution, and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MSS is designed for employees, managers, and remote teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MSS relies on external APIs, cloud storage, and secure data exchange.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MSS requires OAuth authentication, API access, and internet connectivity.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Google Calendar, Outlook, and Zoom APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide a web UI accessible via major browsers.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to create, modify, cancel, or reschedule meetings with participant prioritization (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall analyze availability, suggest alternatives, and propose virtual meetings if no location is feasible (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support agenda management, resource allocation, and location-based preferences (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall send invitations, manage confirmations, and update participants via WebSockets, email, and SMS (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store meeting schedules, availability, and logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for scheduling.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process scheduling requests in 2 seconds and update calendars instantly.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support cloud deployment and modern browsers.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall enforce OAuth 2.0 authentication (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall update meetings in real time via WebSockets, email, and SMS.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Scheduling, conflict resolution, and notifications validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API docs, and sync policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Scheduling best practices, API security, and cloud standards.
